result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Anthony Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark Anthony Harris is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark Anthony Harris was found guilty of Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 07-27-15 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Any  other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Anthony Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark Anthony Harris in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Mark Anthony Harris in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence; STRAIGHT TIME.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 07-27-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Mark Anthony Harris not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Defendant has a pending case in another county.  State to do an Order to Produce for next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Mark Anthony Harris not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Anthony Harris not in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Mark Dluzak was in court earlier.  The State advised the Court that the defendant is in custody in another county.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mark Anthony Harris in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Mark Anthony Harris in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Defendant Mark Anthony Harris not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 2-27-2015. Defendant is in custody at Racine County Jail. Needs to be produced for court. Both files sent to case prep for OTP by Sheriff's department.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 02-27-2015 at 01:30pm
